Summary I am an experienced and versatile I.T. Manager having worked in the industry for 25 years, mostly served in an I.T. Operations, Infrastructure and Service Delivery roles. I have developed skills in managing local, regional and globally dispersed teams, project & program management, vendor and supplier management, strategic technical planning and implementations. I have specialized in Server, Backup and Storage technologies, as well as Sarbanes-Oxley compliance and implementing the ITIL framework. 
 
I have been actively involved with ITIL for 10 years, having taken the Foundation in 2004 and the ITIL Service Manager V2 certification in 2008. My last four roles have had an ITIL focus. At Intel, I implemented Incident & Problem management across a global Operations function; set up a Service Desk and Change Management function within Uniphar; as a Service Manager for a managed services contract in IBM; as Service Support Manager in LeasePlan I was responsible for Incident, Problem, Change and Request Fulfilment processes and the Global Service Desk.  
 
When I left Intel in 2007, I took the opportunity to take a year out. 
 
Specialties: People Management 
ITIL process and implementation 
I.T. Operations management 
Service Delivery Management 
Program/Project Management 
Strategic Technical planning 
Vendor Management

Summary Jessica is the Executive Director of Career Connectors, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to connecting professionals in career transition to hiring companies and quality resources that has helped over 20,000 professionals in career transition. She is a known speaker, trainer and career transition expert. Jessica brings a strong corporate background in organizational development techniques, career coaching, DISC behavioral assessment, training and development, pre-employment assessments, outplacement services and hiring.  
 
Jessica has had the honor of speaking at The White House in the Forum on Job Clubs in the United States, her focus being on employer engagement. She was also named as one of the Women Who Move the Valley for 2013 by the AZ Foothills Magazine, one of Phoenix's 40 Under Forty in 2011 by the Phoenix Business Journal and was also an award nominee for the 2011 and 2014 Phoenix Chamber of Commerce's Athena Awards.  
 
Jessica owns Thrive139, a company dedicated to serving churches and faith-based nonprofits. Thrive139 implements hiring processes and HR systems to ensure clients make solid decisions in hiring the right people for great positions. Its where competency+character+chemistry=culture match.  
 
Specialties: 
Motivational speaking, training and development  
Organizational development, hiring, staffing 
Social Media (LinkedIn, Twitter) 
Communications, cultural differences

Church staffing, church hiring and employee relations Jessica is the Executive Director of Career Connectors, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to connecting professionals in career transition to hiring companies and quality resources that has helped over 20,000 professionals in career transition. She is a known speaker, trainer and career transition expert. Jessica brings a strong corporate background in organizational development techniques, career coaching, DISC behavioral assessment, training and development, pre-employment assessments, outplacement services and hiring.  
 
Jessica has had the honor of speaking at The White House in the Forum on Job Clubs in the United States, her focus being on employer engagement. She was also named as one of the Women Who Move the Valley for 2013 by the AZ Foothills Magazine, one of Phoenix's 40 Under Forty in 2011 by the Phoenix Business Journal and was also an award nominee for the 2011 and 2014 Phoenix Chamber of Commerce's Athena Awards.  
 
Jessica owns Thrive139, a company dedicated to serving churches and faith-based nonprofits. Thrive139 implements hiring processes and HR systems to ensure clients make solid decisions in hiring the right people for great positions. Its where competency+character+chemistry=culture match.
